intro: Bealia, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or purple petals that bloom in early summer. Bealia typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
